final_poem:
As petals unfurl from frosty sleep,
The earth awakens, soft and deep.
Green shoots burst forth in vibrant hue,
And with them, life's sweet symphony anew.

The trees regain their emerald crown,
Their leafy branches dancing in the town.
Blossoms sway on breeze-lit days so bright,
Dance of color against blue skies light.

Crimson anemones lift gentle face,
Snowdrops fade into spring's own pace.
Hope rekindled, life's warm flame revives,
Spring's sweet renewal stirs and survives.
